chapter.para: &productname; is typically configured in two stages, at first during the installation process and after installation you can configure your cluster by using cloud-init. The first stage configuration of &productname; comes as much preconfigured as posible. The second stage is typically used for large scales clusters, if you have just several machine, cloud-init is not necessary.
Each configuration stage is described in the following sections.

sect1.title: Configuration
sect1.para: The defaults for the first stage configuration are the following:
cloud-init is used after the installation is complete. You then define a set of configuration files that will be applied during the boot phase.
The cloud-init configuration can be loaded from different sources. The system searches for the configuration in the following order:

listitem.para: a local disk – cloud-init reads configuration from a local directory: /cloud-init-config
any device that does not have a partition table and contains the vfat or iso9660 filesystem – cloud-init reads configuration from a local directory or from a remote location.

remote location – you must specify an url of the remote location. You should set up the network before you try to use the remote configuration. You can use local configuration files to set up the network as described in .

sect1.para: If there is no configuration within the above mentioned locations, it is supposed that there is no cloud-init configuration.
cloud-init uses the following required configuration files: meta-data, user-data, and an optional file: vendor-data. Each file is described in the following sections.
